Game of the Year Edition

The Zombie apocalypse returns with this content packed edition of the fan favourite. It´s time to return to the beautiful, zombie-infected shores of Banoi!

With the Dead Island Game of the Year Edition players get the chance to experience the full story behind the Banoi Zombie Outbreak. The GOTY includes

  • Dead Island
  • Bloodbath Arena DLC
  • Ryder White DLC
  • Blueprint "The Ripper" Weapon
Get ready for your return to Dead Island, a paradise to die for!

READ MORE

About This Game

Terror. Violence. Madness. Bedlam. A holiday paradise gone mad. A tropical island turns into total chaos after a mysterious zombie outbreak. Cut off from the rest of the world, the player’s only chance to survive is to fight to the death and find a way to escape from the island.
Dead Island combines first-person action with a heavy focus on melee combat, character development and customization of a vast array of weapons. All of these gameplay features are presented in a dark story inspired by classic zombie movies with a gritty and engrossing campaign that can be played with up to four players in co-op mode.
Set in an open world tropical island, hordes of different festering zombies await players around every corner while they embark on a variety of thrilling missions through the holiday resort. With firearms and ammunition being scarce the player must rely on utilizing found items as weapons for self-defense and fight off zombie hordes in intense melee combat. A diverse range of items can be collected and will later serve to transform the player’s ordinary makeshift weapons into serious instruments of destruction.
In addition to satisfying even the most bloodthirsty action fan’s fantasy, Dead Island also features role-playing elements which allow the player to develop one of the game’s unique character classes according to their preferences, all the while learning new skills and fresh tactics during their journey through the perilous environments of the island. What’s more, anytime during a game up to four players can seamlessly join together and experience the intense combat and immersive story with cooperative gameplay.

Key Features

  • First-person melee combat
  • 4-player coop
  • Weapon customization
  • Set on an gorgeous open world tropical island
  • RPG elements for character development
  • Hordes of gruesome zombies
READ MORE

System Requirements

Windows
Mac OS X
SteamOS + Linux
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP
    • Processor: Core2Duo 2.66 GHz
    • Memory: 1 GB RAM
    • Graphics: ATI 2600XT 512MB VRAM (GeForce 8600GT)
    • DirectX®: DirectX 9.0C
    • Hard Drive: 7 GB available hard drive space
    • Other: keyboard, mouse
    Recommended
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: Core2Duo 2.66 GHz
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: GeForce 9600 (1GB)
    • DirectX®: DirectX 9.0C
    • Hard Drive: 7 GB available hard drive space
    • Other: keyboard, mouse
    Minimum:
    • OS: OS X 10.8 and newer
    • Processor: Intel Core i5 2.7 GHz
    • Memory: 8 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVidia GeForce GT 640M 512MB

    • Memory: 1 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Nvidia GT 430 (1024MB)/ ATI Radeon HD 5570 (1024MB) or better
      Note* Intel integrated graphics are unsupported at this stage
    Minimum:
    • OS: Ubuntu 14.0.4
    • Processor: Intel i7 @ 3.5 GHz
    • Memory: 8 GB RAM

Jason Todd
82 products in account
2 reviews
Recommended
305.0 hrs on record
Posted: June 29
DEAD ISLAND
-Alright lets get started on disecting the good, the bad and the Infected out of this game!
PROS-
Good story that will take you hours to complete.
interface easy to understand
Achievements are interesting and fun to get... But not all (eg. "Swing em Sticks" was a real B*tch to get)
A Vast and Complex Weapons system shows the player certain benefits and compromises for each class (Eg. Katana's are fast and Cut well when they can, but have very low durability and make the character tired after a short ammount of time.)
Items placements are normally realistic (For example it'll be much harder to find Weapon Ammo in the Resort than in a Jungle hideout)
Main Characters are Likeable, and provide 4 different play-styles and Overall benefits compared to the next. (Eg. Xian is Knives Expert, Purna is Guns expert, Logan is throwables Expert, and Sam is Blunt Expert. This also means that Sam.B will never have as much Throwing range as Logan because he Logan prides himself in this. Also Logan will not have as much Stamina while handling Heavy Blunt weapons just like Sam. But these many Differences shouldn't change the game in a noticable way, unless you want to pick a character specially because of their Base Benefits, etc.

CONS-
So many Glitches, So So So many
lets just say that getting out of the map wont be a problem on at least act 3 (Jungle)
Just Save you're Testosterone Fuelled Parkour Spirit for Dying light, Please.
Drowning is just a blurry, watery screen that slowly saps your health, DONT try it.
Car mechanics is another story
You don't really need a strategy if you have Shotguns, Machine-guns, Grenades, etc.
Ammo is the REAL currency in this game.
NPC's are Stupid and have unrealistic reactions when facing a Zed
Fetch quests, really?........Escort Quests, REALLY
Serious Clipping Issues during cutscenes as well as close combat.
Arena is a great feature for farming kills, XP, Various rarities of weapons, and general experience of the game... BUT after a few matches You get easily bored of the Combat options and the System feels very inferior overall to the FPS+RPG games that are designed today.
Graphics is reasonable for the time it was made, but the clipping issues along with the Glossiness (like WTF) really makes it difficult to judge the appearance of the Game as a whole.

LAST THOUGHTS=
Story- YES (long and fresh, just like those Bananas I bought Yesterday)
Combat System- YES (Except after long Periods of time in the Arena or Generally just killing anything in your way... Because Yes, It is Sparta!)
Graphics- NO (Glossy as F*ck, This is a Game! not a New Make-up product!)
Bonus Content- YES (Ryder-White Campaign Gives you much more info to the Story, As it is a Prequel. Also Arena is an efficient way of Gaining Kills, Weapons and Experience both in-game and overall appreciation of the eventually unforgiving Combat System. It's kind of a Win-lose situation here to put it Simply, Trust me Guys.
Level/Map Design- No (Boring, Repetitive, Glossy, and Varying are some words to describe the Main map design that you will see throughout the game.
The IDEAS for the map are incredible, but the way that you see them is not very interesting, Metaphorically speaking, its like making the Taj Mahal out of Used matches. Because Many parts are repeated but at the same time so damn cool, [like the View on the Lighthouse] Its difficult to Give an Even opinion on this one.
Best advice, go experience the layout of the map(s) for yourself!

Thanks for reading Everyone, I know it was a long one (LOL, what am i doing with my life) But i tried to give out as much interesting and possibly relatable info as i could in One sitting.
-Kyle out

-Gets steam for Christmas.
-Immediately puts Dead Island on wishlist.
-Fast forward 2 years.
-Email pops up.
"A game on your wishlist is now on sale!"
-Guess what game it was.
-Ask my dad in the midst of Summer Projects.
-Says yes and then starts warning me.
-Stopped listening after yes.
-Launched, started playing for an hour or so.
-Realized I could join people.
-Joined someone.
-He was AFK with his mic on.
-Listened to his mother singing on the radio while cooking.
-wtf
-Start doing missions.
-Can't start a mission without him.
-I go afk for a second to go to the bathroom.
-I get kicked by the afk guy because I was afk
10/10 would play with AFK people again.
